articles.author: TIM REYNOLDS
articles.description: Bill Walton, who starred for John Wooden's UCLA Bruins before becoming a Hall of Famer and one of the biggest stars in basketball broadcasting, died Monday, the league announced on behalf of his family.
articles.title: Bill Walton, Hall of Fame player who became a star broadcaster, dies at 71

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu acknowledged Monday that a “tragic mistake” had been made after an Israeli strike in the southern Gaza city of Rafah set fire to a tent camp housing displaced Palestinians and, according to local officials, killed at least 45 people.
articles.title: Netanyahu acknowledges 'tragic mistake' after Rafah strike kills dozens of Palestinians

articles.author: BRUCE SCHREINER and JULIO CORTEZ
articles.description: A series of powerful storms swept over the central and southern U.S. over the Memorial Day holiday weekend, killing at least 21 people and leaving a wide trail of destroyed homes, businesses and power outages.
articles.title: At least 21 dead in Memorial Day weekend storms that devastated several US states

articles.author: ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden marked Memorial Day with a pledge that the United States would continue the work of the nation's fallen toward creating a more perfect union, "for which they lived, and for which they died for."
articles.title: Biden says each generation has to 'earn' freedom, in solemn Memorial Day remarks

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The testimony in Donald Trump's New York hush money trial is all wrapped up after more than four weeks and nearly two dozen witnesses, meaning the case heads into the pivotal final stretch of closing arguments, jury deliberations and possibly a verdict.
articles.title: Closing arguments, jury instructions and maybe a verdict? Major week looms in Trump hush money trial

articles.author: HYUNG-JIN KIM, KIM TONG-HYUNG and MARI YAMAGUCHI
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A North Korean rocket carrying its second spy satellite exploded midair on Monday, state media reported, after its neighbors strongly rebuked its planned launch. The North's official Korean Central News Agency said it launched a spy satellite aboard a new rocket at its main northwestern space center.
articles.title: North Korea says its attempt to put another spy satellite into orbit has failed

articles.author: DAVID RISING
articles.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The Papua New Guinea government said more than 2,000 people are believed to have been buried alive in a landslide in the South Pacific island nation, after the side of a mountain came down in the early hours of Friday morning when the village of Yambali was asleep.
articles.title: At least 2,000 feared dead in Papua New Guinea landslide. These are some challenges rescuers face

articles.author: RAF CASERT
articles.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — Relations between the European Union and Israel took a nosedive Monday, the eve of the diplomatic recognition of a Palestinian state by EU members Ireland and Spain, with Madrid insisting that sanctions should be considered against Israel for its continued deadly attacks in southern Gaza's city of Rafah.
articles.title: EU and Israel in war of words as ties nosedive ahead of Spain, Ireland recognizing Palestinian state

articles.author: TERRY TANG and MIKE SCHNEIDER
articles.description: The federal government recently reclassified race and ethnicity groups in an effort to better capture the diversity of the United States, but some groups feel the changes miss the mark.
articles.title: Armenians, Hmong and other groups feel US race and ethnicity categories don't represent them

articles.author: TIM REYNOLDS
articles.description: Bill Walton, who starred for John Wooden's UCLA Bruins before becoming a Hall of Famer and one of the biggest stars in basketball broadcasting, died Monday, the league announced on behalf of his family.
articles.title: Bill Walton, Hall of Fame player who became a star broadcaster, dies at 71
